definition: to sound the night watches (on clappers or gongs, in former times)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)

sentences.english: At the end of the day, I kept texting and calling even more.
sentences.chinese: 結果在當天，我繼續短她並給她打更多電話。

sentences.english: I want to play more games than last year.
sentences.chinese: 我希望比去年打更多比賽。

sentences.english: There are things worse than beatings.
Hopefully I'll get more games in pre-season, I'll try to do my best.
sentences.chinese: 希望我能打更多季前賽，我會盡全力的。

sentences.english: Then, I only am need to play more competitions , retrieves self-confidently unceasingly.
sentences.chinese: 接下來，我只是需要打更多的比賽，不斷地找回自信。

sentences.english: In those situations you know that in order to play more often you have to do more on the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 你知道如果要打更多比賽的話就得在場上更努力。

sentences.english: Black Cat is another same game with more score if you hit more cats.
sentences.chinese: 黑貓是另一種更評分，如果你打更多的貓一樣的遊戲。

sentences.english: They also sleep more than the rest of us, and take more naps.
sentences.chinese: 他們比其他人睡得也更長，並且打更多的盹。

sentences.english: It's good for your game if you play a lot.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能打更多的比賽的話，對自己會是很好的提高。

definition: watchman's clapper/wooden clappers with bars of unequal length
to be on all-night duty/to be on night watch/to keep a vigil
to patrol at night, marking the time by sounding clappers or gongs
soldier's copper saucepan, used for cooking food by day and for sounding the night watches during the hours of darkness (in ancient times)
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
Tongluo or Tunglo township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan
to go to work/to start work
